character.flavor: Just like the terrestial type, just IN SPACE!!!

character.name: Magna Populator
character.flavor: It's just a  big cat... A REALLY BIG cat...

character.name: Magna Ultima Populator
character.flavor: It's just a big... Actualy, no, this no longer just a big cat.

weapon.name: Battle Ax
weapon.flavor: A classic weapon emblematic of destructive force.

weapon.name: Kinetic Rifle
weapon.flavor: In an age of lasers and rockets, making something really hard go really fast can still cause a lot of trauma

weapon.flavor: While it's still iconic, this version does not one-shot the enemy. Most of the time.

weapon.name: Razor Claws
weapon.flavor: Nature's daggers: shaped by millenia and honed by the wild.

weapon.name: Saber Fangs
weapon.flavor: Monstrous incisors with the potential to pry your tin can open.

armor.name: Basic Armor
armor.flavor: The minimum armor required to survive interstellar radiation

armor.name: Bararium Armor
armor.flavor: Armor from a special alloy that raises the Bar on protection

armor.name: Thick Fur
armor.flavor: The creature is covered in thick fur. Which is less impressive since you're in a mech, but- hey- that's what evolution gave it.

item.name: Repair Bot
item.flavor: A modest, battery-powered robot which repairs your mech

item.name: Tazer
item.flavor: 1k Gigazolts will disarm just about anything

resource.name: Provisions
resource.flavor: Food. It may be space, but food is still just food.

resource.name: Battery
resource.flavor: Your standard ZZZ Battery that gets slapped in the back of your everyday electronics

resource.name: Scrap
resource.flavor: Reuse, Recycle... don't Reduce; we need every piece we can get

resource.name: Biomaterial
resource.flavor: Biological matter from living organisms that doesn't have any obvious use

resource.name: Kinetic Slugs
resource.flavor: Solid metal chunks of bad intentions

resource.name: Geolocating Marker
resource.flavor: A nifty little device that can maintain a connection between mech and transport no matter the planet's magnetic field strength or corrosivity of its atmosphere. A must-have for every Wanderer.

resource.name: Enhanced Biomaterial
resource.flavor: The creature this material came from spent a long period in the vacinity of Auron Crystals, mutating its DNA causing it to be larger and smarter than others of its type.

transport.name: Lugger
transport.flavor: It's old and rusty, but this stellar tugship is up to the task of hauling your mech from sector to sector.

transport.name: Brig
transport.flavor: A proper starship with ample space for a mech bay

transport.name: Barge
transport.flavor: A large space-fairing ship with ample room for supplies

sector.name: Scavenge Scrap
sector.flavor: Take The Colony's Scrap Collector out for a joy ride.

sector.name: Residential Sector
sector.flavor: Housing for residents of The Colony.

sector.name: Scout Bots
sector.flavor: This sector maintains Scout Bots which periodically scout nearby planets for food and supplies.

sector.name: Farm Bots
sector.flavor: A vertical farm fueled by artifical light. Sure, it only grows greens, but when you're adrift in space you can't really be picky.

job.name: Grow Food
job.flavor: The colonists farm, weed, prune, pick, water, and do whatever is necessary to get food from the ground and from trees in the colony

job.name: Charge Batteries
job.flavor: The works run on (futuristically-efficient) treadmills in order to charge batteries

game:
Your transport's reactor dies, and with it any hope of getting home.

You slowly drift through space, and the coldness of space slowly drift into you.

As your body freezes you become unable to look at anything but the darkness of space ahead of you.

    And in the end, you become the darkness yourself.

Blood and atmosphere leaks through the holes in your spacesuit. You watch helplessly as it streams through breaches in the cabin that you can no longer repair.

Your vision becomes blurry. You slowly lose your grip on the flight stick as your hands go numb. The ship's sirens which were piercing your ears have become a distant clamor.

You're not sure if it's the radiation leaking through,
    or the blood in your eyes,

        but the only remaining sensation


            is red.

You are unbalanced. You are unfocused. You are confused.

You can't remember what happened.
  Was it an enemy?
  Was it radiation?
  Was it an accident?

You collapse to the floor... and will never know the reason why.
colony:
Exploring space is naturally dangerous; interstellar conditions will naturally damage your ${transport}.

    You cannot travel into space without ${repairbot}s.
messagelog: You exchange old batteries for new ones
The last of the power drains from the ${population}
The lights are dim around the ${population}
gameplay: With your mech badly damaged, you seek refuge within a Dark Shell.
The Dark Shell sputters as the new batteries resuscitate it
Looking around the hull in the dim light, you spot a salvaging rig. You think you can get it working with the scrap you have.
Having noticed activity in the Shell, a local Trader stops by and offers to barter with you in the future.
The Shell is much larger than you first realized. It looks like it would be a very productive hub if you could power additional sectors.
Having secured yourself a transport, you can now prepare to return to Space.
A recently-arrived immigrant says he's familiar with the engineering behind the ${population}'s Battery Charging Room and volunteers to fix it so other residents can operate it.
